author: schone_wizard
content: With stateless ethereum. Would it be possible to run one beacon node client implementation where you downloaded all the data and point lets say three other client implementations to that one node and not have the same (now quadrupled) space requirements on disk?

author: schone_wizard
content: The thinking is that if one holds multiple validators today. You’re almost by necessity of disk space (and some network bandwidth) forced to choose one client. But the path to running multiple client split between your different public keys isn’t really so far from being viable

author: schone_wizard
content: Ie one entity/person owning multiple validator deposits running multiple clients on one single machine

author: djrtwo
content: stateless ethereum would apply to the execution-layer state. The current thoughts on requirements would be that you still need the beacon-state (which is relatively small)
